intro: Eupatorium catense, commonly known as white boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. Eupatorium catense is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and fever-reducing properties.
